intro: Ochna dolicharthros, commonly known as the long-fruited ochna, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Ochnaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are typically elliptical or ovate in shape. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in panicles, followed by woody, elongated fruits. Ochna dolicharthros is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important component of the understory vegetation in its native ecosystems.
